app_tagline: Find a therapist without losing your mind
chat_reset_confirm: Really start over? All your progress will be lost.
contacts_empty_hint: Contact therapists via the chat - they'll appear here.
contacts_qualifying_hint: You have enough contact attempts documented for the reimbursement process!
email_body_intro: I am looking for a therapy appointment for {therapy} and have {insurance}.
email_body_question: Could you let me know if you are currently accepting new patients? If not, what would be the approximate waiting time?
email_body_thanks: Thank you in advance for your response.
email_body_urgent: My situation is urgent, so I would greatly appreciate a prompt response.
karl_edit_hint: No problem! Just click the pencil icon on your answer to edit it. When you're ready:
karl_for_other_name: Okay! What's the name of the person you're searching for? (First name is enough)
karl_greeting: Hey! I'm KARL. I help you find available therapy spots - so you don't have to call 30 practices yourself.
karl_location: Where should I search? Give me your postal code.
karl_location_error: I didn't quite understand that. Can you give me a postal code?
karl_location_with_name: Got it, I'm searching for {name}. Where should I search? Give me their postal code.
karl_no_results: Hmm, I couldn't find any matching therapists. Would you like to adjust the criteria?
karl_preferences: Any special preferences? Select what fits, then click "Continue".
karl_process_explanation:
Good question! So, our goal is to find you a therapy spot. Either directly at a practice - or if that doesn't work out, through the cost reimbursement process.

Here's how it works:

1. Initial consultation via the appointment service (116 117) - they'll get you an appointment within 4 weeks. You'll get the PTV-11 form there, important for later.

2. Contact therapists - I'll help with that. We write emails and make calls together. We document every rejection.

3. If you find someone: Great, done!

If not, we keep searching and go the reimbursement route. Optional: trial sessions via the appointment service. With enough rejections (long wait times count too) you prove system failure.

Insurance will deny it first - no worries, file an appeal. Works almost every time. Then they'll pay for private practices too, which have openings way more often.

Sounds like a lot? Don't worry, I'll guide you through it!
karl_research_prompt: Your search criteria have changed. Should I merge the new results with the existing ones or replace them?
karl_results_encouragement: Don't worry, you don't have to contact all of them! Start with 2-3 that feel right to you.
karl_results_found: I found {count} therapists! Click "Send email" to contact them directly.
karl_therapy_type: What type of therapy are you looking for?
landing_intro: Need a therapist but calling 30 practices feels impossible right now?
landing_intro_bold: KARL helps you - step by step, at your own pace.
landing_privacy: No sign-up needed. Your data stays on your device.
pdf_intro: This document records my efforts to find a therapy spot. It serves as proof for the cost reimbursement process according to Â§ 13 Para. 3 SGB V.
pdf_legal: According to Â§ 13 Para. 3 SGB V, insured persons are entitled to cost reimbursement if the health insurance cannot provide an urgent service in a timely manner. For psychotherapeutic treatments, a waiting time of more than three months is generally considered unreasonable.
terminservice_explanation:
Good question! The appointment service (116 117) can get you an initial consultation with a therapist within 4 weeks. This is important because:

1. You get a professional assessment of whether therapy is right for you
2. The therapist can issue you a form that helps you get a spot faster later
3. If you need urgent help, this gets noted in the system

Afterwards you can contact therapists yourself in parallel - with the form you'll have better chances.
terminservice_intro_message: Before contacting therapists directly, I recommend getting an initial consultation via the appointment service. It's quick and free!
terminservice_online_how: Great! Go to eterminservice.de, select "Vermittlungscode: Nein", then "Psychoth. Sprechstunde Erwachsene" (or Kinder & Jugendliche).
terminservice_online_tip: Enter your postal code. After the consultation the therapist fills out a PTV form - make sure "urgent" is checked!
terminservice_online_unavailable_detail: Online booking for postal code {plz} is unfortunately not always available. You can still try - if it doesn't work, better call instead.
terminservice_phone_tip: Say you need a psychotherapeutic initial consultation and give your postal code. After the consultation the therapist fills out a PTV form - make sure "urgent" is checked!
terminservice_plz_online_available: Online booking available for postal code {plz}
terminservice_plz_online_unavailable: Online booking may not be available for {plz} - calling recommended
